title: Panthers relied on Marchand's 'magic' in Cup run
content: Acquired at the trade deadline from the Boston Bruins, forward Brad Marchand, 37, was a driving force behind the Florida Panthers' Stanley Cup run, which ended Tuesday night at Amerant Bank Arena, where the Edmonton Oilers were eliminated in Game 6.

title: Bennett wins Conn Smythe after NHL-high 15 goals
content: Panthers forward Sam Bennett, who led the NHL playoff field with 15 goals, including five in the Final, was named the winner of the Conn Smythe Trophy on Tuesday night.

title: Clark, Fever to vie for Cup after scuffles mar win
content: Caitlin Clark and the Fever advanced to the Commissioner's Cup championship game after defeating the Sun in a physical game that included a pair of scuffles and three late ejections.

title: PL fixtures: Man United vs. Arsenal on opening day
content: Arsenal begin their Premier League campaign with a trip to face Manchester United and then away games against Liverpool and Newcastle United.

title: Ruggs apologizes to victim's family at Vegas event
content: Former Raiders wide receiver Henry Ruggs III, on special release Tuesday night, spoke at a Hope for Prisoners event in Las Vegas and apologized to the family of a woman he killed in a car crash nearly four years ago.

title: Lynx back in Cup final, but Collier exits with injury
content: The Lynx will try for their second straight Commissioner's Cup championship after advancing to the final Tuesday night, but star Napheesa Collier left early with a back injury.

title: Devers: Boston in past, will play where Giants want
content: Rafael Devers was formally introduced by the Giants on Tuesday, strolling into the clubhouse side-by-side with Barry Bonds. And whatever went wrong in Boston, Devers is done discussing any issues he had with the Red Sox and eager to move forward.

title: Yanks' bats 'in a little rut,' blanked in 3rd straight
content: The Yankees' scoreless innings streak reached 29 innings after Tuesday night's 4-0 loss to the Angels, which marked their fifth straight loss.

title: Sportsbooks divided on Cup favorite for 2026
content: Odds to win the 2026 Stanley Cup are already up at sportsbooks, and there is disagreement in the betting market regarding which team should be the favorite heading into the offseason.

title: üèÜ Reactions to Panthers' Stanley Cup win
content: The Florida Panthers secured the back-to-back Stanley Cup final wins on Tuesday night with a Game 6 win on home ice.

title: Updated NBA mock draft with movement in the top 10: How we see Rounds 1 and 2, eight days out
content: With the draft eight days away, Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo share the latest intel from around the league.

title: Let's lay out the Spurs' offseason options: Three potential trade offers to entice them
content: San Antonio strives to "build something that's sustainable," it has options, and we have three trade offers.

title: Spaun's stunning U.S. Open victory shakes up Ryder Cup race, plus favorites at The Open
content: Who will be the favorites in The Open? Will J.J. Spaun's unlikely victory propel him to more wins? With the U.S. Open finished, we look ahead in the 2025 season.

title: A wedding during the MCWS?! More than one ring is on the line for Louisville's Tanner Shiver
content: Louisville's Tanner Shiver is competing in the MCWS this week, but he's still planning on getting married Friday.

title: Inside Gage Wood's MCWS masterpiece
content: No hits, 119 pitches and one historic performance. Gage Wood was electric in his no-hitter for Arkansas.

title: First Betts, now Devers? Red Sox ownership under fire from fans -- again
content: John Henry & Co. traded another franchise icon. The only thing they can do to appease the Fenway faithful now? Win.

title: What Sunday's shocking trade means for the East, the KD saga and the NBA draft
content: The shocking deal has ramifications far beyond Orlando and Memphis -- including the Kevin Durant trade saga.

title: A transfer window already opened and closed: What did it reveal about new tactics?
content: The first transfer window has offered hints as to what Liverpool, Chelsea, others want to do differently.

title: 'We compromised the NBA Finals': How WCW capitalized on Rodman-Malone hoops rivalry
content: Marc Raimondi's excerpt from "Say Hello to the Bad Guys" looks at the nWo storyline involving two Hall of Famers.

title: Texas State, cryptic posts and the Pac-12's next move
content: Texas State looms as the favorite to join the Pac-12. Why could that happen? What would come next? And what about Memphis?

title: 'Secret love for soccer' put Freeman on U.S. path
content: United States and Orlando City SC fullback Alexander Freeman said he had a "secret love of soccer" growing up after not following the same sporting footsteps as his father, former NFL player Antonio Freeman.

title: FIFA: Nearly 1.5 million CWC tickets sold so far
content: Fans from over 130 countries have purchased nearly 1.5 million tickets for the Club World Cup that kicked off last weekend in its newly expanded format across the United States, FIFA said on Tuesday.

title: Pep signals Grealish's City exit: 'He has to play'
content: Pep Guardiola suggested on Tuesday that Jack Grealish should seek a new club to rekindle his passion for the game after two years on the sidelines at Manchester City.

title: Sergio Ramos, Monterrey secure draw with Inter
content: Champions League finalist Inter Milan was held to a 1-1 draw by Monterrey in their Club World Cup opener, with goals from Sergio Ramos and Lautaro Mart√≠nez.

title: Xabi expects 'instant impact' from TAA, Huijsen
content: Xabi Alonso praised the "instant impact" of Real Madrid signings Trent Alexander-Arnold and Dean Huijsen on Tuesday, calling the new arrivals "top players" ahead of the team's Club World Cup debut.

title: Sources: Williams, Eze among Bayern's targets
content: Rafael Le√£o, Nico Williams, Bradley Barcola and Eberechi Eze are among Bayern Munich's potential targets, sources told ESPN.

title: Spurs chief: Sacking Ange 'emotionally difficult'
content: Tottenham Hotspur chairman Daniel Levy has described the recent decision to sack former manager Ange Postecoglou as "emotionally difficult."

title: Washington signs Juve, Italy star Sofia Cantore
content: The Washington Spirit have acquired forward Sofia Cantore via transfer from Serie A side Juventus, making Cantore the first Italian international in NWSL history.

title: üëÄ What it really means to 'get Concacafed'
content: This summer's Concacaf Gold Cup is sure to provide a lot of shenanigans, and not just for the USMNT. But what exactly makes North and Central American soccer so brutal and silly?

title: USMNT eases pressure with big win to open Gold Cup, but tougher tests ahead
content: Sunday's big win should relieve some pressure on a U.S. team that's been struggling for form and harmony of late. However, it's clear bigger tests are ahead at this Gold Cup and beyond.

title: An 11-year NBA veteran and the emergency transplant that saved his life
content: Sixteen months ago, Scot Pollard was in active heart failure, about to die. Then came a lifesaving transplant, uniting two families -- and two fathers -- forever. Watch E60's "Heart of Pearl" at 1 p.m. ET on ESPN.

title: AI 171 crash probe widens: Ahmedabad airport ground staff quizzed; sabotage angle not ruled out
content: A multi-agency investigation is underway at Ahmedabad's SVPI Airport following the Air India AI 171 crash, which killed 241. Ground handling agencies are under scrutiny, with staff questioned and phones seized. The probe, involving AAIB, Gujarat Police, AAI, DGCA, and the NTSB, seeks to determine the cause, including potential sabotage.

title: Why PM Modi turned down Trump's invite to meet in US
content: Following the G7 Summit in Canada, US President Donald Trump invited Prime Minister Narendra Modi to visit the United States, but Modi declined due to prior commitments. Instead, the two leaders spoke by phone, during which Modi invited Trump to India for the next Quad summit, which Trump accepted with enthusiasm.

title: EXCLUSIVE | IND vs ENG: 'Gambhir, not Gill, will be in the spotlight'
content: TimesofIndia.com caught up with former England spinner Monty Panesar, who played 50 Tests and took 167 wickets, for an in-depth chat about Gambhir‚Äôs big challenge, India‚Äôs new captain Shubman Gill, the team‚Äôs prospects in England, Kuldeep Yadav‚Äôs potential impact, and more.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Lone survivor Viswashkumar Ramesh discharged from hospital
content: Viswashkumar Ramesh, the lone survivor of the Air India AI-171 crash near Ahmedabad, was discharged from the hospital after six days. The British national, who lost his brother Ajaykumar in the disaster, recalled hearing strange noises and the pilot's distress call before the crash.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos-Sanchez wedding: Venice Mayor says 'I am ashamed'
content: Jeff Bezos's upcoming Venice wedding has sparked controversy, dividing residents. While city officials, like Mayor Luigi Brugnaro, welcome the event for its economic benefits and visibility, some locals protest, expressing resentment towards the mega-wedding. The "No Space for Bezos" collective voiced their opposition, highlighting the city's struggle to balance its historical identity with modern tourism.

title: FASTag-based annual pass announced! Eligibility, validity and more details
content: Starting August 15, 2025, a ‚Çπ3,000 FASTag-based Annual Pass will be available for private vehicles like cars, jeeps, and vans. Valid for one year or 200 trips, this pass streamlines toll payments on National Highways across India.

title: 'India will never accept mediation': PM Modi's clear message to Trump
content: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri clarified that Prime Minister Modi firmly stated India's consistent rejection of third-party mediation, particularly concerning counterterrorism actions like Operation Sindoor in Pakistan. PM Modi emphasized to President Trump that discussions focused on India's anti-terror efforts and conveyed that India views terrorism as an actual war, not a proxy one, with full political unanimity on this stand.

title: Exclusive | 'Why would I come to India if Bangladesh had chess tournaments?': 80-yo Rani Hamid
content: In a captivating encounter at the Delhi International GM Open Chess Tournament 2025, 80-year-old Rani Hamid, a Bangladeshi chess legend, faced 13-year-old prodigy Balaji Sudarshan. Despite a recent string of losses, Hamid's spirit remained undeterred. Sudarshan's skill led to Hamid's defeat, but the two engaged in a post-game analysis, transcending their age gap through their shared passion for chess.

title: When Elon Musk suggested Boeing's problem may be having too many managers who are ...
content: Following the Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad, which killed 241 passengers and crew, safety concerns have risen. A resurfaced tweet from Elon Musk criticizing Boeing's management has added fuel to the fire. The DGCA has ordered enhanced safety inspections for Air India's Dreamliner fleet.

title: Woman jumps off roof after being caught with lover; husband fears for his life
content: In Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat district, a married woman leaped from a hotel roof and fled after her husband allegedly discovered her with another man. Locals apprehended the alleged lover, Shobhit, and handed him over to the police. The husband, who followed his wife to the hotel after a counseling session, has filed a complaint, fearing for his safety.

title: ‚ÄòEverything on the table‚Äô: India eyes assurance Trump won‚Äôt impose additional tariffs
content: India seeks guarantees from the US against future tariffs as they finalize a bilateral trade agreement. India wants tariff stability, especially for labor-intensive sectors like leather and textiles. The goal is to secure preferential trade advantages through mutual duty reductions before the July 9 deadline.

title: 'You are the best': Meloni compliments PM Modi at G7 Summit - watch
content: The camaraderie between PM Modi and Italian PM Meloni, affectionately known as "Melodi," was a highlight at the G7 Summit in Canada. Their informal meeting, set against the backdrop of the Rocky Mountains, involved discussions on terrorism and global issues. A viral video captured Meloni complimenting Modi, saying, "You are the best.

title: Delete WhatsApp from phones, it sends ...: Iran govt tells citizens; WhatsApp responds
content: The Iranian government is advising citizens to delete WhatsApp, alleging it shares user data with Israel. This follows previous bans on social media platforms, including WhatsApp itself during past protests. WhatsApp has refuted these claims, expressing concern that the advisory is a pretext for blocking the app when people need it most.

title: Hyderabad's Begumpet Airport gets bomb threat; alerts sounded, search ops on
content: A bomb threat email triggered a security alert at Hyderabad's Begumpet Airport on Wednesday morning, prompting a thorough search operation. Police have confirmed that bomb disposal teams are currently scanning the airport and its surrounding areas to ensure safety. The Assistant Commissioner of Police, Begumpet, stated that the search is ongoing following the receipt of the threatening email.

title: 'Shocking': SC on Madras HC order to arrest ADGP in kidnapping case
content: The Supreme Court criticized the Madras High Court's order to arrest ADGP H M Jayaram in a kidnapping case, deeming it "shocking and demoralising." The court questioned the Tamil Nadu government about Jayaram's suspension and sought clarification on its revocation.

title: Monsoon mayhem in Gujarat: 18 dead in 2 days; Saurashtra flooded, rescue ops on
content: Heavy rains in Gujarat, particularly Saurashtra, caused 18 deaths since Monday. Most victims were struck by lightning. Normal life was disrupted in Rajkot, Amreli, Morbi, and Surendranagar. Overflowing rivers and dam releases led to alerts. Botad and Bhavnagar districts received extreme rainfall. Rescue operations were conducted for people trapped in floodwaters.

title: 'Posed as cousin to abduct him': UP man kills groom day before wedding
content: In Rampur, Uttar Pradesh, Mohd Saddam was arrested for allegedly murdering Nihal. Police said Saddam wanted to stop Nihal's wedding because he loved the bride-to-be. Saddam and an accomplice lured Nihal out and strangled him. Police identified Saddam from CCTV footage. Saddam confessed and led police to the body and the victim's phone.

title: IND vs ENG: What is it like facing Jasprit Bumrah? Ollie Pope reminisces
content: England's Ollie Pope acknowledges Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional skill, emphasizing the challenge of facing him across multiple series. Pope highlights the strategy of rotating strike to avoid Bumrah bowling consecutive deliveries and utilizing his full range of skills. Stuart Broad suggests the series outcome depends on Bumrah's fitness, with England hoping he doesn't play all five Tests.

title: PM Modi heads to Croatia after Canada visit - what's on agenda
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has embarked on a historic visit to Croatia, marking the first time an Indian Prime Minister has visited the Balkan nation. Following his Canada visit, Modi is scheduled to meet with Croatian President Zoran Milanovic and Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic to bolster bilateral ties.

title: Israel hits centrifuge site in Iran: Why its a big blow to Tehran's nuclear aims
content: Israeli military conducted extensive airstrikes on Iranian military infrastructure, including a centrifuge production site in Tehran, escalating the conflict between the two nations. The IDF targeted Iran's nuclear weapons development efforts and missile production industry, citing uranium enrichment beyond civilian needs. As casualties mount and missiles are exchanged, President Trump demands Iran's unconditional surrender, while Iran vows retaliation.

title: West moves away from China, Bangladesh - India‚Äôs apparel exports see big growth
content: India's apparel exports are experiencing robust growth, driven by Western buyers seeking alternatives to Bangladesh and China. A significant 11.3% year-on-year increase in May signals a recovery from post-pandemic stagnation. Duty advantages over China and political instability in Bangladesh are further fueling this surge, presenting a major opportunity for Indian manufacturers in the US market.

title: 'For 37 days ...': Cong demands all-party meet after Trump's call to PM Modi
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh urged PM Modi to convene an all-party meeting to address discrepancies between Indian and US accounts regarding discussions during the G7 Summit, particularly concerning Trump's mediation claims on India and Pakistan. Ramesh questioned PM Modi's silence and criticized Donald Trump's invitation to Pakistan's army chief Munir.

title: 'I don't care': Trump ignored intel Iran wasn't building nuclear weapon
content: US President Trump dismissed his intelligence chief's assessment that Iran wasn't building a nuclear weapon, aligning himself with Israel's Prime Minister Netanyahu. Despite Iran's claims of peaceful nuclear activities, concerns persist over its enriched uranium levels, prompting military actions by Israel and raising regional tensions. ‚Äã‚ÄãTrump is now weighing a possible direct attack on Iran‚Äôs underground nuclear site in Fordow.

title: Regime on edge: If Khamenei is slain, who will rule Iran?
content: Amidst escalating tensions with Israel and the loss of key advisors, questions arise about the future leadership of Iran. With Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei increasingly isolated, potential successors are being considered. Figures like his son, Mojtaba Khamenei, and influential officials such as Ali Asghar Hejazi are in the spotlight.

title: 'Liquor scam' probe: Ex-YSRCP MLA Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy arrested in Bengaluru
content: Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy, a close aide of Jagan Mohan Reddy and ex-Chandragiri MLA, was detained by SIT officials while attempting to travel to Colombo. He and co-accused Venkatesh Naidu have been taken to Vijayawada for questioning and are likely to be produced before the ACB court today.

title: IND vs ENG: Karun Nair recalls 2018 snub by Kohli and Shastri ‚Äî 'It felt like...'
content: After an eight-year wait, Karun Nair is on the verge of a Test comeback at Leeds. Once dropped and overlooked in 2018, the batter opens up on heartbreak, healing, and how his resilience has inspired even coach Gautam Gambhir.

title: NASA astronauts prepare ‚Äòspace sushi‚Äô aboard the ISS in zero gravity
content: International Space Station astronauts celebrated with 'space sushi'. Jonny Kim shared the crew's creative meal on social media. They used rice, spam, fish, gochujang, and wasabi. Limited supplies didn't stop them. Astronauts taped surfaces to keep food from floating. The meal boosted morale and fostered connection. Social media users admired their resourcefulness and ingenuity.

title: ¬£100M F-35 fighter jet stranded in Kerala: Technical snag or something else?
content: A British Royal Navy's advanced F-35B fighter jet is grounded at Thiruvananthapuram International Airport in Kerala after an emergency landing due to a suspected hydraulic failure. The incident occurred on Saturday night during a routine flight from the HMS Prince of Wales. Despite ongoing repairs by Royal Navy technicians, the $100 million stealth fighter remains stranded, guarded by CISF.

title: 'India now regards terrorism not as proxy war but actual war': PM Modi tells Trump, warns Pak
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received condolences from US President Donald Trump on Wednesday following the Pahalgam terror attack, which tragically resulted in 26 fatalities, according to Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri. The two leaders had planned to engage in bilateral discussions during the G7 summit, but the meeting was canceled due to President Trump's shortened trip to Canada.

title: BPSC 71st recruitment: Bihar Commission increases vacancies ahead of Preliminary exam
content: The Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) has revised the vacancy count for the 71st Combined Competitive Examination (CCE) 2025, raising it from 1,250 to 1,264 posts. The update includes 14 newly added Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) roles. The move comes ahead of the Preliminary exam, with applications open until June 30.

title: Israel-Iran conflict: Tehran fires hypersonic missile - 10 key points
content: Tensions escalate as Iran confirms using hypersonic missiles against Israel, prompting a stern warning from President Trump, who hints at knowing Ayatollah Khamenei's location. Khamenei vows retaliation, rejecting mercy for Israel. Trump rebuffed an Israeli plan to eliminate Khamenei, fearing further destabilization, while the US military repositions forces amid evacuation concerns.

title: Your locker may be sealed! Haven‚Äôt signed updated agreement? Here‚Äôs what banks may do
content: Customers with bank lockers risk losing access if they don't sign revised rental agreements, with about 20% facing potential denial due to missed deadlines. Banks are seeking authorization to issue final notices and seal lockers for non-compliance, as the RBI monitors adherence to updated guidelines.

title: Gold price prediction 24 karat India: Where is rate headed amidst Iran-Israel tensions?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are volatile due to Middle East tensions and speculation about Federal Reserve rate cuts. Gold has surpassed the euro as the second-largest reserve asset, fueled by central bank buying. Focus remains on geopolitical events and upcoming Fed meetings, which will influence gold's trajectory, while domestic demand in India is currently subdued.

title: IND vs ENG: Coffee, selfies, window seat fight, India players get nostalgic
content: On their train ride to Leeds for the first Test, Indian cricketers shared fond childhood memories of train travel. A BCCI video captured their nostalgia, fan interactions, and light-hearted moments, highlighting personal stories from Washington Sundar, Dhruv Jurel, Sai Sudharsan, and Shardul Thakur.

title: 'Nations that openly support terrorism rewarded': PM Modi slams double standards
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the G7 Outreach Session in Kananaskis, urging world leaders to unite against terrorism and eliminate double standards. He emphasized holding countries accountable for supporting terrorism and called for strict action against those who promote it. PM Modi also engaged in productive discussions with several leaders, focusing on strengthening trade ties and addressing global challenges.

title: 8 benefits of drinking amla, beetroot and carrot juice every morning
content: Incorporating amla, beetroot, and carrot juice into your daily routine offers a wealth of health benefits. This juice isn‚Äôt a shortcut to health, but rather a gentle daily ritual ‚Äì one that supports the body silently. Whether it‚Äôs for energy, digestion, skin, or hair, the benefits come from patience and consistency.

title: Exclusive | 'England will target Gill... try and knock him over': Nick Knight
content: Former England batter Nick Knight anticipates an intriguing India-England Test series, despite the absence of key players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. Knight believes that India's emerging talents, such as Sai Sudharsan, are ready for international cricket.

title: 'The battle begins': Iran's Khamenei hits back at Trump's threats; US may join strikes
content: Tensions escalate as Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei declares ‚Äúthe battle begins‚Äù following threats from US President Trump. Iran launched ballistic missiles at Israel, prompting retaliatory airstrikes in Tehran and Karaj. Israel's military campaign aims to dismantle Iran's nuclear and missile programs.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 below 24,850; BSE Sensex dips over 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was below 24,850, BSE Sensex was down over 100 points.

title: Chess | Fabiano Caruana takes a dig at D Gukesh - 'not scary yet'
content: Fabiano Caruana has downplayed the hype around India‚Äôs young chess stars, saying Gukesh and Arjun Erigaisi aren‚Äôt "scary" opponents yet. Despite their rise, Caruana believes the likes of Magnus, Hikaru, and Aronian still hold the edge, suggesting the generational shift in chess isn‚Äôt happening just yet.

title: Air India snag strands flyers overnight in Delhi airport; Union minister among passengers
content: Air India flight AI-2489 from Delhi to Bhubaneswar was grounded Tuesday night due to a technical snag, leaving passengers stranded for hours at Delhi's IGI Airport. Union Minister Jual Oram and Dr. Subrat Acharya were among those affected. Passengers, including women and children, waited at Terminal 3 with no confirmed alternate flight.

title: 'Nahi chahiye biryani!': Shastri reveals chat that angered Shami; resulted in heroics
content: Ravi Shastri and Bharat Arun revealed that Mohammed Shami's anger over biryani fueled a match-winning performance against South Africa in 2018. During lunch on the fourth day of the final Test, Shastri noticed Shami with a large serving of biryani. Shami, angered by the comment, rejected the biryani and went on to take a five-wicket haul, securing India's victory.

title: Axiom-4 launch delayed again: NASA cites space station repairs
content: The Axiom-4 mission, featuring India's Shubhanshu Shukla, has been further delayed and is now targeted for launch on June 22. This postponement allows NASA additional time to assess space station operations following recent repair work on the International Space Station's Evezda service module. The mission was initially scheduled for May 29 before being moved to June 8.

title: US shuts Jerusalem embassy; no evacuation for Americans announced
content: Amid escalating military tensions between Iran and Israel, the United States will close its embassy in Jerusalem from Wednesday through Friday. This decision follows missile strikes in Jerusalem and Tel Aviv, with minor damage reported near the US Embassy's Tel Aviv branch.

title: IND vs ENG: Hussain makes bold prediction, says India will miss Rohit, Virat
content: Nasser Hussain has dismissed India‚Äôs chances in the upcoming Test series, citing the absence of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Predicting a 3-1 win for England, he emphasized home advantage as the key factor favouring Ben Stokes‚Äô side.

title: 'Suryavanshi doesn't eat anymore': Father; Dravid advices him to stay away from ...
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old, is making waves in the IPL. Rajasthan Royals selected him. He became the youngest centurion. Prime Minister Narendra Modi encouraged him. Concerns arose about his weight. Rahul Dravid is guiding him. Suryavanshi is training with the India Under-19 team in the UK. The cricket community is watching his progress.

title: McLaren's Montreal miscues give F1 rivals hope for rest of 2025
content: Sunday's Canadian GP was the first podium in 2025 that didn't feature a McLaren. Is the tide about to turn on F1's runaway leader?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye move for Hudson-Odoi
content: Manchester United are looking to sign Nottingham Forest's Callum Hudson-Odoi. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Debunking the 'Man United tax' myth
content: Transfer chiefs have complained for years, but it's on the club to stop paying over the odds for players.

title: PM must call all-party meeting upon his return to brief leaders on what he told Trump: Congress
content: The PM should have conveyed India's displeasure to reports that Pakistan Army Chief Gen Asim Munir would be having lunch with Donald Trump, Congress said

title: Nilambur bypoll in Kerala: Opposition UDF accuses LDF of stoking Islamophobia for Sangh Parivar votes
content: V.D. Satheesan‚Äôs riposte comes as a counter to LDF‚Äôs accusation that UDF sacrificed secular-democratic principles and brazenly solicited support of ‚Äòradical Islamist‚Äô Jamaat-e-Islami for political expediency in Nilambur

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: 190 victims identified by DNA tests, 159 bodies handed over to kin
content: Authorities are carrying out DNA tests to establish the identity of the Ahmedabad Air India plane crash victims as many bodies were charred beyond recognition or damaged

title: Karnataka government urged to include water woes of Kolar, Chikkaballapur and Bengaluru Rural districts in agenda for June 19 Cabinet meet
content: Shaashwatha Neeravari Horata Samithi, which is seeking resolution of the water woes of the three parched districts, submitted a memorandum in this regard to Chief Secretary Shalini Rajneesh

title: Semma!: How James Beard-winning chef Vijay Kumar is making Tamil cuisine international
content: This chef from Madurai‚Äôs Natham has just won the prestigious James Beard Awards for best chef in New York State. His unapologetically rural cooking, from Dindigul biriyani to snail pirattal, is changing how the world sees Indian food

title: Air India‚Äôs Bali-Delhi flight diverted to Varanasi due to bad weather
content: Air India flight AI 2146 had to be diverted as poor weather conditions over Delhi severely reduced visibility

title: Uttar Pradesh Police recruitment drive: Unnecessary hype over routine exercise, says Mayawati
content: Mayawati questioned whether all communities received fair representation and raised concerns over the quality and the future of the training being provided to the recruit

title: NMC notices are part of routine process, steps underway to address gaps: Telangana DME
content: Government medical colleges, in particular, undergo periodic audits to identify and address issues such as faculty shortages, infrastructural gaps, and missing or outdated diagnostic equipment, said the DME

title: ‚ÄòThug Life‚Äô release in Karnataka: Police serve notice to Kannada activist Praveen Shetty
content: Any protest or dharna must only be held in Bengaluru‚Äôs Freedom Park, the designated place, failing which strict action will be taken, the notice stated.

title: Inclusive development key to India becoming global power: Jitendra Singh
content: Launching the Dharti Aaba Janjatiya Gram Utkarsh Abhiyan in Nagaland, Union Minister Jitendra Singh emphasises inclusive development in Nagaland, highlighting technology-driven agriculture and tribal welfare schemes for progress

title: Maharashtra makes Hindi ‚Äògeneral‚Äô third language in schools
content: Some Marathi language advocates accused the government of reintroducing the mandatory Hindi policy through the "backdoor" after initially backtracking

title: Lucknow-Mumbai flight cancelled due to operational issues: Air India
content: Air India stated that the cascading impact of flight diversions caused by heavy rains in Delhi also contributed to the decision to cancel the flight.

title: Kerala Revenue department reclaims prime Kochi land worth crores after over 50-year legal battle
content: The land which fell under multiple survey numbers was declared excess after 1963 land reforms. But it could not be acquired after owners resorted to litigation

title: Will seek clear explanation from Centre: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge after clearance ‚Äòdenied‚Äô for U.S. trip
content: He said he was holding back from making public statements and would enquire about the denial of his trip once he returns to Bengaluru

title: Top Maoist leader among three killed in exchange of fire in A.P.‚Äôs  Maredumilli forest
content: The exchange of fire took place between the group of Maoists and the Greyhounds, the elite Anti Naxal Squad of the State police department.

title: Telugu expats in Israel on the edge but not ready to return to India
content: Many from Telangana and Andhra Pradesh are employed as caregivers to the elderly Israelis living alone

title: Bhadra reservoir ICC appeals to farmers on left bank not to grow water-intensive crop this kharif season
content: Bhadra dam authorities will be replacing the gate on the left bank canal, and the work will take one-and-a-half months to complete

title: Three judges of Madras High Court escape ‚Äòapparent‚Äô train derailment attempt
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar, G.K. Ilanthiraiyan and Krishnan Ramasamy were travelling in Yercaud Expres along with retired judges K. Kalyanasundaram and M. Govindaraj

title: Schools that hired drivers who failed alcohol test in Bengaluru to be questioned by police
content: 58 drivers, among the 4,559 who took the alcohol test in a three-hour-long campaign across Bengaluru, were found driving while under the influence of alcohol

title: Singapore-flagged cargo ship fire: Police file case against owner, captain and crew of MV Wan Hai 503
content: FIR says ship was navigated rashly in a way that could be dangerous to human life, despite the presence of flammable materials, chemicals, and explosives on the vessel

title: Mumbai's Powai Lake overflows after heavy rains
content: Having a storage capacity of 545 crore litres, the Powai Lake is not potable and is used only for industrial purposes.

title: TTD proposes to name Renigunta airport after Lord Venkateswara
content: A Lord Venkateswara temple to be built in Bengaluru; a CSIR lab to be set up in Tirupati to check the quality of material used in preparation of prasadam

title: Karnataka rains: Hemavathi dam shutters to be opened, alert issued
content: The crest gates could be opened any time as water level has been rising due to heavy rains in the catchment area

title: Goyal to discuss India-U.K. FTA implementation with British counterpart during 2 day London visit
content: The pact aims to eliminate duties on labour-intensive Indian exports such as leather, footwear and clothing, while easing imports of U.K. products like whisky and cars

title: IT, ITES sectors to benefit the most with 10-hour shifts
content: The amendment will legitimise the violation of working hours that is already happening in the sector, says the CITU

title: Karnataka proposes to increase daily working hours, overtime
content: The Karnataka government, in its draft amendment, has cited the Union government‚Äôs directions to all States to consider amending the working hour limits through legislative or regulatory changes appropriately

title: The third, non-political players in Tamil Nadu‚Äôs electoral battlefield dominated by Dravidian majors
content: Ever since the State politics began having duopoly, numerous parties and individuals had attempted to forge a viable alternative to the two principal players, the DMK and AIADMK. So far, success has eluded them.

title: New Zealand Gives Nod To 'Magic Mushrooms' For Medicinal Purpose
content: New Zealand on Wednesday approved the medicinal use of psilocybin, a hallucinogenic compound notably found in so-called "magic mushrooms".

title: Jagan Reddy's Aide Arrested At Bengaluru Airport In Andhra Liquor Scam Probe
content: Andhra Pradesh Police have arrested Jagan Mohan Reddy's aide and YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) general secretary Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy in the multi-crore liquor scam.

title: AI For Nuclear Launch Decision Is "True Doomsday Scenario": Study
content: Using artificial intelligence (AI) to manage nuclear weapon systems poses a catastrophic risk for humanity, the world's top institute on conflict research, SIPRI, has said in its 2025 yearbook.

title: About US GBU-57, Only Buster Bomb Capable Of Hitting Iran's Nuclear Sites
content: A powerful American bunker-busting bomb is the only weapon capable of destroying Iran's deeply buried nuclear facilities, making it President Donald Trump's weapon of choice if he chooses to militarily back Israel.

title: Trump Administration Ordered To Issue Passports To Trans Americans With 'X'
content: A federal US judge on Tuesday ordered the Trump administration to resume issuing passports to transgender Americans with "X" as their gender designation, a practice suspended since Donald Trump's return to the White House.

title: Bihar Teen Forcefully Married To 33-Year-Old Man. Supreme Court Steps In
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday issued a notice to the Bihar government on a petition filed by a 16-year-old girl, who is "facing threat" for refusing to continue her "coerced" marriage with a 33-year-old man.

title: "Mummy Just Watched": Boy, 9, Says He Saw "Uncle" Smother Father With Pillow
content: A nine-year-old boy has become the key witness in a case where his father was allegedly murdered by his mother in collusion with her lover and a group of hired contract killers.

title: Georgia's Brain Dead Woman Delivers Prematurely, Baby On Life Support
content: The baby of a woman in Georgia who was declared brain dead and has been on life support since February was delivered early Friday morning, her mother said.

title: India A "Bright Spot" Amid Global Uncertainty: Chief Economic Advisor
content: India remains a rare "bright spot" in a world facing growing uncertainty, said Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran, pointing to the country's steady economic performance despite ongoing global challenges.

title: Heavy Rain Expected In Delhi Tonight, Orange Alert Issued
content: Moderate to heavy rain accompanied by lightning and thunderstorms is predicted in the national capital tonight, India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert. AQI remains satisfactory.

title: In War Against Iran, Israelis Face Challenges They Were Never Familiar With
content: When Israel first targeted Iran on June 13 in what it called precision strikes to curtail Tehran's nuclear ambitions and killing high-ranking officials, not many thought Tehran would retaliate on this scale.

title: G7 Expresses Support For Israel, Calls Iran Source Of Instability
content: The Group of Seven nations expressed support for Israel in a statement issued late on Monday and labeled its rival Iran as a source of instability in the Middle East, with the G7 leaders urging broader de-escalation of hostilities in the region.

title: 796 Babies Buried Under Shelter Home For Unmarried, Pregnant Women
content: Unmarried pregnant women were sent to Bon Secours Home run by a group of Catholic nuns, who used to take care of both the children and the mothers.

title: "Act Of Terror Will Be Considered An Act Of War": PM Modi Tells Trump
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi informed US President Donald Trump that India will regard any act of terrorism, not as proxy actions, but as acts of war, stated Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri on Wednesday.

title: PM Declines Trump's US Invite Over Scheduling Issues, Invites Him To Quad
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday spoke with US President Donald Trump and set the record straight that Operation Sindoor was "paused" following a request from Pakistan and not due to mediation or offer of a trade deal by the US.

title: Father-Son Siphon Off Rs 64 Lakh From Indore Court' Bank Account, Arrested
content: Police have arrested an IT expert and his father who allegedly siphoned off Rs 64 lakh from the bank account of an Indore district court and spent it on foreign trips and buying expensive mobile phones, an official said.

title: All About Fattah-1, Iran's Hypersonic Missile Fired At Israel
content: Iran on Wednesday claimed to have fired hypersonic missiles at Israel in the latest round of overnight strikes as the Islamic republic's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, launched a battle cry, calling for showing "no mercy" toward Israelis.

title: Bhopal Bridge With 90-Degree Turn To Be Redesigned After Memes Go Viral

title: Shaquille O'Neal to join WWE 2K25 roster with Tyrese Haliburton
content: The next DLC pack for WWE 2K25 is just over a week away, and the second of the mystery NBA stars being added to the game has been revealed. Shaquille O'Neal will join  Tyrese Haliburton  in the "Dunk & Destruction Pack." Shaq has had a lot of involvement in the pro-wrestling world over the years. Back in 2016, he was a surprise competitor at WrestleMania 32's Andre the Giant Memorial Battle Royal, where his massive 7-foot-1 frame stood up to the equally huge Big Show. Then in 2021, Shaq turned to AEW, competing in a tag team match with the then-debuting Jade Cargill against company founder Cody Rhodes and Red Velvet. Alongside Shaq, Haliburton and the one NBA star yet to be announced, this DLC pack features The Great Khali, a former world champion in WWE, and Abyss, a former TNA wrestler who now works as a backstage producer for WWE. It is scheduled to release on June 25, 2025.
